description: There are various game theoretic models of cheating. I give results from simulations of various models of cheating-in-game-play collected from my own open source python code (MIT). These results are extended to a "society at large" model of the result of cheating-at-game-play. I discuss some overt and less overt counter-measures to cheating-at-game-play in the context of online test taking.
title: To Catch a Cheat
